messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] How to learn about unschooling (was Math phobia, aga...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 29/04/2003 11:58:06 Pacific Daylight Time, ... This again sounds a bit snide to me. I may be wrong , but perhaps that is part of the problem
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 29/04/2003 11:58:06 Pacific Daylight Time,
rubyprincesstsg@... writes:


> Would it be argumentative to say THANK YOU one more time, just in case I
> haven't said it often enough... THANK YOU to each of you that respond

This again sounds a bit snide to me. I may be wrong , but perhaps that is
part of the problem you are having here, Glena?
There is also a lot of yelling with capitals in your posts, make them seem a
little over the top. I am following this with interest, but find all the
emphasis with capitals hurts my head.
Nancy in BC
(maybe it is just the cold I am brewing)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] How to learn about unschooling (was Math phobia, aga...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/03 12:58:06 PM, rubyprincesstsg@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/03 12:58:06 PM, rubyprincesstsg@... writes:

<< Would it be argumentative to say THANK YOU one more time, just in case I
haven't said it often enough... >>

I would much rather you had not responded at all and done some of the other
reading and experimenting. But the post you responded to had specific
recommendations of how I thought you could really show that you were paying
attention and appreciated the advice, and you blew that off to come and give
us more of the same same same same old same.

So yes, it did seem argumentative.

Do you want to unschool? Then you need to try some of the things we've been
recommending.
Do you want others to be glad you're on this list? Then don't post so much.
Do you want to just see your own words in writing? Then keep a journal or
e-mail yourself.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] How to learn about unschooling (was Math phobia, aga...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/2003 2:29:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Would it be argumentative to say THANK YOU one more time, just in case I haven t said it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/2003 2:29:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> you're not
> being gracious or courteous or showing any appreciation for the gift you're
>
> being given.
>

Would it be argumentative to say THANK YOU one more time, just in case I
haven't said it often enough... THANK YOU to each of you that respond with
endless patience, gentle advice and for each of you that takes the time to
try to show another person the path you've long since walked to unschooling.

glena
